summary: The patient, John, has shown inconsistent adherence to his diabetes management plan over the reported period. He initially presented with elevated glucose after admitting to eating cake at a party, expressing disappointment but also acknowledging the difficulty of adhering in social situations. Despite an initial commitment to follow his meal plan and exercise, subsequent high glucose readings indicated a lapse in both diet and activity. John attributed this non-adherence to a stressful week at work, citing lack of time and energy, and resorting to "quick things to eat" instead of healthier options. Furthermore, he explicitly admitted to forgetting his insulin dose before breakfast, leading to a significant glucose spike. While John demonstrates awareness of his mistakes and expresses frustration, his engagement in exploring proactive solutions, such as quick meal options or home exercises, was low. Overall, despite honest admissions of non-adherence, maintaining consistent adherence to medication, diet, and exercise routines remains a challenge, often influenced by external stressors.
